title: Say hello to summer with these giftworthy ideas
description: Giftable ideas for summer. All the best tools, gadgets, and seasonal upgrades for your home, yard, and beyond.
excerpt: Get geared up for the season.
text: Memorial Day marks the unofficial start of summer, which means barbecues, extended vacations, and lots of time outside. Get in gear with our top picks for everything you need to have the best time ever. Think of these as your summertime essentials: All the best tools, gadgets, and seasonal upgrades for your home, yard, and beyond. Anker Nebula Capsule 3 Projector Best for outdoor movie nights Stop watching movies on your phone and gift your family the entertainment upgrade it deserves. Our reviewer called this small, portable projector "lightweight and perfectly packable," making it ideal for camping and summer travel. Coleman Inflatable Hot Tub Best for relaxing The best thing about this inflatable hot tub is that it doubles as a regular ol' pool. (Only smaller.) Just keep the heat low (or off) during the heat of the summer, making it perfect for a quick dip. Then when the the temperatures drop off in the fall, go for the heated soak. SPONSORED Shop the Home Depot sale Best for saving big Get up to 35% off select furniture, rugs, and mattresses during Home Depot's Memorial Day sale — live through June 4. Sylvox Outdoor TV Best patio upgrade Turn your back deck into an extension of your living room with an all-weather TV like this one from Sylvox. It's waterproof and sunproof, with an anti-glare screen that's well-suited to the outdoors. L.L.Bean Pima Percale Sheets Best for catching up on sleep There is something almost magical about a freshly made bed. This set of pima percale sheets from L.L.Bean are crisp and cool, perfect for summertime sleeping with the windows open and the breeze blowing through. Solar-powered outdoor lights Best for creating ambiance One of the most enjoyable parts of summer is when the daytime hang keeps going long after the sun has gone down. These adorable globe lights make that easy — and stylish. Plus since they're solar-powered, you'll never have to remember to turn them on. AirTags Best for keeping track of things Can't find the diaper bag for the hundredth time? Live in fear of lost luggage? Want to keep tabs on everyone at the amusement park? Enter: The humble AirTag. Apple's flagship tracker can be affixed to nearly everything and easily pairs with the Find My app. Insulated Cooler Tote Best for picnics I have this cooler and I swear by it. Great for taking to the beach, keeping snacks cool in the car, or for a day of exploring tucked under our stroller. It's easy to wipe clean on the inside and is deceptively large, plus it has that classic L.L.Bean look, which I love. Raised Garden Bed Best for flexing that green thumb Whether you're just getting into gardening or you're a seasoned pro who can never have enough plants, this snazzy raised planter makes a welcome (and stylish) addition to your yard. Try flowers that cascade down for some curb appeal or stock it with herbs that you can snip from while cooking. Ninja Creami Best for making homemade ice cream Whether you've seen this all over TikTok or are just learning about it now, this beloved kitchen gadget is quickly becoming a summertime essential. After waiting the necessary 24-hour freezing period, use it to transform simple ingredients into creamy ice cream in minutes. Aventon E-Bike Best for exploring An e-bike takes a bit of the edge off your pedaling efforts, giving you a slight assist while cruising around town. This model from Aventon can go up to 60 miles on a charge and comes with fat, 4-inch tires that can handle a host of terrain. Kamado Joe charcoal grill Best grill upgrade Kamado Joe charcoal grills may be trendy, but it's for a good reason. This smart model is a combination grill and smoker, which comes complete with an autostart function and temperature controls that can be manipulated via an easy-to-use app.
html:
Memorial Day marks the unofficial start of summer, which means barbecues, extended vacations, and lots of time outside. Get in gear with our top picks for everything you need to have the best time ever. Think of these as your summertime essentials: All the best tools, gadgets, and seasonal upgrades for your home, yard, and beyond.

Anker Nebula Capsule 3 Projector

Best for outdoor movie nights

Stop watching movies on your phone and gift your family the entertainment upgrade it deserves. Our reviewer called this small, portable projector "lightweight and perfectly packable," making it ideal for camping and summer travel.

Coleman Inflatable Hot Tub

Best for relaxing

The best thing about this inflatable hot tub is that it doubles as a regular ol' pool. (Only smaller.) Just keep the heat low (or off) during the heat of the summer, making it perfect for a quick dip. Then when the the temperatures drop off in the fall, go for the heated soak.

SPONSORED

Shop the Home Depot sale

Best for saving big

Get up to 35% off select furniture, rugs, and mattresses during Home Depot's Memorial Day sale — live through June 4.

Sylvox Outdoor TV

Best patio upgrade

Turn your back deck into an extension of your living room with an all-weather TV like this one from Sylvox. It's waterproof and sunproof, with an anti-glare screen that's well-suited to the outdoors.

L.L.Bean Pima Percale Sheets

Best for catching up on sleep

There is something almost magical about a freshly made bed. This set of pima percale sheets from L.L.Bean are crisp and cool, perfect for summertime sleeping with the windows open and the breeze blowing through.

Solar-powered outdoor lights

Best for creating ambiance

One of the most enjoyable parts of summer is when the daytime hang keeps going long after the sun has gone down. These adorable globe lights make that easy — and stylish. Plus since they're solar-powered, you'll never have to remember to turn them on.

AirTags

Best for keeping track of things

Can't find the diaper bag for the hundredth time? Live in fear of lost luggage? Want to keep tabs on everyone at the amusement park? Enter: The humble AirTag. Apple's flagship tracker can be affixed to nearly everything and easily pairs with the Find My app.

Insulated Cooler Tote

Best for picnics

I have this cooler and I swear by it. Great for taking to the beach, keeping snacks cool in the car, or for a day of exploring tucked under our stroller. It's easy to wipe clean on the inside and is deceptively large, plus it has that classic L.L.Bean look, which I love.

Raised Garden Bed

Best for flexing that green thumb

Whether you're just getting into gardening or you're a seasoned pro who can never have enough plants, this snazzy raised planter makes a welcome (and stylish) addition to your yard. Try flowers that cascade down for some curb appeal or stock it with herbs that you can snip from while cooking.

Ninja Creami

Best for making homemade ice cream

Whether you've seen this all over TikTok or are just learning about it now, this beloved kitchen gadget is quickly becoming a summertime essential. After waiting the necessary 24-hour freezing period, use it to transform simple ingredients into creamy ice cream in minutes.

Aventon E-Bike

Best for exploring

An e-bike takes a bit of the edge off your pedaling efforts, giving you a slight assist while cruising around town. This model from Aventon can go up to 60 miles on a charge and comes with fat, 4-inch tires that can handle a host of terrain.

Kamado Joe charcoal grill

Best grill upgrade

Kamado Joe charcoal grills may be trendy, but it's for a good reason. This smart model is a combination grill and smoker, which comes complete with an autostart function and temperature controls that can be manipulated via an easy-to-use app.
